intro: Silene vulgaris subsp. marginata, commonly known as the pink campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while the stems are usually hairy. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils.
